parameter.name: apply
parameter.help: By default, states are not applied. It is often convenient to assign this attribute as a constraint in the tag. For example: state name="mystate" apply="parent.opened" will apply the state if parent.opened is true.

parameter.name: pooling
parameter.help: If true, the state will merely hide any views it has created when it is removed, instead of destroying them.

parameter.name: onapply
parameter.help: Script that is executed when the state is applied to its parent.

parameter.name: onremove
parameter.help: Script that is executed when the state is removed from its parent.
